cons: Consuming corn can lead to allergies and symptoms like rashes on the skin, swelling of mucous membrane, vomiting, etc.
Corn adversely affects people suffering from diabetes as it increases the blood sugar level in the body.
description: Corn is a good source of the phenolic flavonoid antioxidant, ferulic acid.
Ferulic acid plays a vital role in preventing cancers, aging, and inflammation in humans.
Corn has significantly higher levels of phenolic flavonoid pigment antioxidants such as ß-carotenes, and lutein, xanthins and cryptoxanthin pigments along with vitamin-A.
It also contains good levels of some of the valuable B-complex group of vitamins such as thiamin, niacin, pantothenic acid, folates, riboflavin, and pyridoxine.
name: Sweet Corn
pros: Corn is a good source of the phenolic flavonoid antioxidant, ferulic acid.
Ferulic acid plays a vital role in preventing cancers, aging, and inflammation in humans.
Corn has significantly higher levels of phenolic flavonoid pigment antioxidants such as ß-carotenes, and lutein, xanthins and cryptoxanthin pigments along with vitamin-A.
It also contains good levels of some of the valuable B-complex group of vitamins such as thiamin, niacin, pantothenic acid, folates, riboflavin, and pyridoxine.
Yes, you can eat sweet corn in pregnancy.
Corn contains folic acid, fiber, vitamins B1, B5, and C, improves digestion, strengthens circulation and also aids lactation.
